Text: Quick Tips from Genealogycom Quick Research Tips for Discovering Your Family Story START WITH WHAT YOU ALREADY KNOW When youre first starting out collecting information about your ancestors may seem like an enormous task But you may already know much of the information about your close relatives TO GET STARTED The best place to start collecting information is with the most recent generation This may be you your children or perhaps your grandchildren Record the basic genealogical information that you know about your close relatives Full names Birth dates and birthplaces Marriage dates and marriage places Death dates and death places if applicable Take these facts and enter them into your family tree software or other documentation source When you have collected information about yourself and any younger generations then start working backwards with your parents grandparents and so on as far back as you can remember FIND OUT EVEN MORE ABOUT GETTING STARTED The Getting Started tip above was excerpted from the Genealogycom HowTo Guide To read the complete article and get more details select the link below mainmenuhtml To explore even further check out these FREE lessons and
